channel.title: Poisen hitting?
channel.description: Well, when ever i poisen someone on my server, or i am poisned, after that all hits with the weapons are like poisen hits (they are green htis, not regular red) does anyone know how to fix this.

item.title: Poisen hitting?
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

[quote=“Shogunreaper, post:34, topic:190863”] protected void appendHitUpdate(stream str) { try { str.writeByte(hitDiff); // What the perseon got 'hit' for if (hitDiff > 0 && newhptype == false && poisondmg == false) { str.writeByteS(1); // 0: red hitting - 1: blue hitting } else if (hitDiff > 0 && poisondmg == true) { str.writeByteS(2); // 0: red hitting - 1: blue hitting 2: poison 3: orange } else if (hitDiff > 0 && newhptype == true) { str.writeByteS(hptype); // 0: red hitting - 1: blue hitting } else { str.writeByteS(0); // 0: red hitting - 1: blue hitting } NewHP = (playerLevel[playerHitpoints] - hitDiff); if (NewHP <= 0) { NewHP = 0; IsDead = true; } str.writeByte(NewHP); // Their current hp, for HP bar str.writeByteC(getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerHitpoints])); // Their max hp, for HP bar poisondmg = false; } catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

Okay…thats what i got…i have no idea what im doing lol.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 19, 2008, 03:49:57 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Envion link=topic=254419.msg2121200#msg2121200 date=1205981245]

Without looking at anything, my guess is this: You have an if statement, something like:

if (poisoned) { //not exact parameters
//makes green splats here
}

Yeah, that makes the poison, but it doesn’t work. You’d have to do something like:

if (poisoned) { //not exact parameters
//makes green splats here
} else {
//turns splats back to normal
}

That would be much, much more efficient. This way it changes back to normal splats if it isn’t poison. Oh, and at the “Change your source.” guy, go away. Horrible advise and no help.

Actually, that’s pretty much wrong. I’m fairly certain the core does not differentiate between damage types. It does the switch between visual damage appearance, sure, but without core support for multiple damage types (physical, poison, special (orange)) and periodic damage applications (I suppose we could call them auras?), you’re not going to get far.
[/quote]

What do you mean.[/quote]

Exactly what I said. In order for us to do this correctly, we need to have the server differentiate between three damage types:

Physical - incoming, up-front damage. Applied once on damage taken assuming we do not have a miss.
Poison/periodic - delayed, taken over time. Timer initiated on begin, one timer per applier (a poisoned dagger will not poison the same target 15 times simultaneously this way, but will apply/refresh only one timer). Should take in a set amount of damage and a period of time, in seconds, to apply it over. Let’s say damagePeriodic(args: dmg, time).
Special - applied with the orange “splat”. Special damage - I believe this takes effect on all stats, reducing each stat’s temporary value by x.

In this way, we tell the server to apply damage of a certain type, and the rest is handled for us. For poison, a timer is set from a specific source - say, DDS+ held by player PlayerOne - and we do not create more timers on each application from PlayerOne’s DDS+, but instead refresh the amount of time left on the original timer. We’re not switching back and forth between different icons, but instead applying damage in its native type.

Read full topic

item.title: Poisen hitting?
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

[quote=“Envion, post:33, topic:190863”][quote author=LeScape link=topic=254419.msg2121058#msg2121058 date=1205978319]
Without looking at anything, my guess is this: You have an if statement, something like:

if (poisoned) { //not exact parameters
//makes green splats here
}

Yeah, that makes the poison, but it doesn’t work. You’d have to do something like:

if (poisoned) { //not exact parameters
//makes green splats here
} else {
//turns splats back to normal
}

That would be much, much more efficient. This way it changes back to normal splats if it isn’t poison. Oh, and at the “Change your source.” guy, go away. Horrible advise and no help.
[/quote]

Actually, that’s pretty much wrong. I’m fairly certain the core does not differentiate between damage types. It does the switch between visual damage appearance, sure, but without core support for multiple damage types (physical, poison, special (orange)) and periodic damage applications (I suppose we could call them auras?), you’re not going to get far.[/quote]
Alright, but what that does is change it to green when poison is right, but it doesn’t change it back when it’s not.

Read full topic
